review: The Fire TV Stick replaced my AndroidTV stick and it has been great so far. There have been a few network issues, but I believe those are due to my network hardware. It needs more apps, but for the sale price I purchased them it's hard to complain. The ability to add software like XBMC/KODI is also nice. Altough it didn't completely replace my Chromecast stick due to easy of casting certain apps from my phone, it has become my goto device when wanting to see a Netflix or Amazon Prime show or movie.

review: I purchased Apple TV last year because I own an iMac, iPad, iPhone, and iPod and love the integration between all of them, but something was missing. I signed up for Amazon Prime because there were tons and tons of movies and TV shows I couldn't get anywhere else and watched them on my iMac, iPad Mini, or my Windows laptop. When Fire TV Stick came out, I thought about it and thought about it, but thought I already have all of these other products, how much more can I watch??? When I saw that I could get the Fire TV Stick for $39 I had to get it. It took a few weeks because of it's popularity, but it was well worth the wait. It took literally 5 minutes to set it up and log into Netflix and HuluPlus. It comes with your Amazon Prime accvount already activated, so there's a big plus right there. I was watching Season 2 of Under the Dome in no time at all! The only negative that I found (which was not Amazon's fault) was that Xfinity does not support Showtime Anytime of Fire TV. I can't wait for HBO Go this spring!
